name: Meme
description:
“In the negotiations of information within the 'fake news'  pandemic, the biggest vector for information organisations, reception, and circulation, has been the digital meme. The meme aestheticizes information and weaponizes it in what can be characterised as 'aesthetic warfare'. Looking at a variety of memes and the way they proliferate, one can identify how memes naturalize, and their direct consequences on human agency, rights, and freedom.”
– Nishant Shah

Nishant Shah is Director of Research & Outreach and Professor of Aesthetics and Cultures of Technologies at ArtEZ University of the Arts, The Netherlands. He is affiliated with Harvard University’s Berkman Klein Centre for Internet & Society and Leuphana University Lüneburg’s Centre for Digital Cultures.
